search_query: ANSYS ANSS competitors 2025 simulation software engineering
context: ANSYS is a leading engineering simulation software provider with 39.85% market share in the simulation-modeling category, competing with 56 competitor tools. The company was acquired by Synopsys on July 17, 2025 for approximately $35 billion, following a definitive agreement announced in January 2024. Over 14,229 companies worldwide use ANSYS as a simulation-modeling tool, with 4,271 customers from the United States. The 2025 R2 release features enhanced physics solvers, streamlined workflows, and new AI tools to accelerate simulations.

competitors.name: Simulink
competitors.notes: Top competitor with 17.95% market share in simulation modeling. Part of MathWorks' MATLAB platform. Widely used for programming, modeling, and simulation.

competitors.name: ANSYS Structures
competitors.notes: ANSYS's own product with 7.16% market share. Internal competition within ANSYS product family.

competitors.name: SolidWorks Simulation
competitors.notes: 4.76% market share. Easy-to-use FEA structural analysis tools integrated with SolidWorks CAD. Supports linear, non-linear static and dynamic analysis capabilities.

competitors.name: COMSOL Multiphysics
competitors.notes: Versatile simulation platform integrating various physics phenomena. Features Model Builder and Application Builder for complex engineering challenges.

competitors.name: Abaqus
competitors.notes: High-performance FEA tool known for nonlinear simulations, hyperelastic materials, crash tests, and advanced material modeling. Handles nonlinear and high-deformation simulations more gracefully than ANSYS Mechanical.

competitors.name: Siemens NX
competitors.notes: Premium enterprise-grade CAE solution with extremely accurate solvers. Clean CAD-to-simulation workflow. More cost-effective for small to medium-sized businesses with transparent pricing.

competitors.name: Altair HyperWorks
competitors.notes: Full simulation suite for advanced engineering - structural, CFD, EM, optimization, composites, manufacturing. Insanely fast solver performance, especially OptiStruct. Note: Altair was acquired by Siemens in 2025 for $10.6 billion.

competitors.name: SimScale
competitors.notes: Cloud-based platform revolutionizing CAE by providing 100% web browser access. Enables CFD, FEA, Thermodynamics, Acoustics and Particle Analyses.

competitors.name: OpenFOAM
competitors.notes: Free, open-source CFD software developed by OpenCFD Ltd since 2004. Extensive features for fluid dynamics, solid mechanics, and electromagnetics. Supported globally by ESI Group.

competitors.name: Autodesk Fusion
competitors.notes: Cloud-based platform integrating CAD, CAM, CAE, and PCB software. Comprehensive simulation and generative design capabilities.

competitors.name: Synopsys
competitors.notes: Acquired ANSYS on July 17, 2025 for $35 billion. This was Synopsys's largest acquisition, expanding its TAM by 50% to $28 billion.
